title: Lugard voyage to the Niger MCQ 2

content.prompt: The instructions to Lugard in articles (d) and (f) best reflect which of the following regarding the purpose of the board of directors’ letter?

choices.label: As a high-ranking agent of the British Royal Niger Company, Lugard would have been likely to recognize on his own the economic potential of the areas he was about to explore.

As a commercial enterprise, the British Royal Niger Company hoped that Lugard’s voyage would allow it to expand its exports of African raw materials to Europe and its imports of European finished goods to Africa.
As tropical disease made travel in Africa dangerous to Europeans, the board of directors needed to emphasize the economic rewards that Lugard would personally reap if his mission was successful.
As a transnational company competing for business on the global market, the British Royal Niger Company wished to obtain information about the financial resources of its competitors.

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain the point of view, purpose, historical situation, and/or audience of a source.
